number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 22, 2015
												Wicked Game!DDE started out as a remake of Dungeon Defenders, which was an EPIC game (if i do say so myself). But since DDE's release its become something more then Dungeon Defenders, Because of its constant getting updated, its gotten alot more content and the leveling system was changed in Dungeon Defenders they level cap was eventually raised to lvl 100 which the intro of new patches. as where with Dungeon Defenders Eternity, all that content is already in, but the level cap is sitting back at the original cap of lvl 60, which allows alot more room for upgrades in the future.BY FAR THE BEST MMO Tower Defense game, i've seen out there. although its not fully a tower defense game, because you can also run around as a character and shoot, swing big♥♥♥♥♥♥swords, fire lasers, use magic projectile to kill you're enemies or you could just sit back and let you're towers and pets do the killing for you. This game covers alot of different play styles and is great fun with friends or by yourself.of course every game isn't without if flaws or boring parts. a couple of boring parts i've found are the massive grinds to get end level gear (although this might be boring, it can also be quite enjoyable). Dungeon Defenders Eternity took everything about Dungeon Defenders and made it even better.But don't take my word on it, play it for yourself and enjoy!!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												I'd like to start with this quote from the game description:"Dungeon Defenders Eternity is the definitive version of the original..."Literally I totally agree, it defines everything that Trendy is and has shown in the original. Its poorly polished, has a nasty clunky interface, the rarther random group making overlay looks dated, is unintuetive and seems entirely unessisary. Features simply dont work, like the "show Equippable only" filter, just does nothing, or only hides a few unequippable items.What saves this monstrosity of ugly is the game itself, you and your towers stand between the enemy and their goal, a simple, replayable joy. However that said the "rebalence" of the game is freaking awful, you spend most of your time sifting through gear you wont be able to wear for days of play as it is far above your level, beating maps on insane difficulty if not only possible at single digit levels but laughably easy... I really dont know what they consider balenced about the items you find now, the few you can wear have huge stats on them wildly screwing up what little semblence of balence there is...Would I reccomend this game? No. Simply because if Trendy consider this mess to be what defines their game they deserve nothing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												Don't bother with this till it actually works would be my recommendation.You can't make or join game sessions. I'll revisit my review when I actually get to try to join a map.Revisit 1: what a difference a day makes, a tiny patch and we get:Games can be launched so you can actually playSolo hosting of dungeonsAs it's all streamed running in and hitting stuff seems a bit hit and miss especially if your trying to dodge their attacks back at you hopefully that'll improve.The rest seems like classic Dungeon Defenders. After a bit more play maybe it'll grow on me more for now I'd say wait as it may just need some tweaks to make bring it up to being something I'd recommend.Revisit 2 : well after leaving the game for months with some patching gave it a go again.Now plays pretty well, there are differences compared to the original dungeon defenders in terms of the difficultly... you won't be able to do Nightmare unless you have a good mix of lvl 60s in pretty good gear... but the gear is grindable and when you do get good enough gear you can you quickly gear up (a great deal easier, quicker and it's possilble to do solo without needing help). You won't see many players around but the ones you do meet are friendly and will try and help others... balancing has shifted it slightly from what you may expect if you played the original but it's still fun.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
												What is there to say about DDE? If you love character customization and by that i mean choose everything from whether you want to fight or let your towers kick♥♥♥♥♥to making your fat cat with a propeller bright pink just cause it makes you look like a badass.Dungeon Defenders combines Tower Defense and 3rd person combat in a sexy way! I could tell you everything epic about DD but it's better you find out for yourself. They have regular updates that are persuaded by you, yes you choose what you want to happen on DDE and they make it happen. People wanted private taverns and the developers made it, people wanted Nightmare mode released but more of a challenge and the developers made it. People now want DDE to create their Hardcore mode WITHOUT perma-death and the developers have listened and are in the process of making that happen.Enough said, now buy it!That was back in October 2014 and it is now January 31st 2015I am changing my review on DDE because they have just released a new 'balanced' version of the game and well... it has destroyed the entire game completely.All characters stats that were considered good (3,000+) now are beyond disgracegful. All players have lost about 90% or their DPS on towers, the monks auras have been halfed and to make thinks even worse Series EV has had a tower change so there is no longer a tower buff beam.I am not playing DDE for another month and will see if they have rectified this barbaric change to what was an actual decent game and I do NOT recommend you buy this or even play it if you have it.R.I.P DDE Was Decent from version 3.2 up and till version 5.4

After a bit more play maybe it'll grow on me more for now I'd say wait as it may just need some tweaks to make bring it up to being something I'd recommend.Revisit 2 : well after leaving the game for months with some patching gave it a go again.Now plays pretty well, there are differences compared to the original dungeon defenders in terms of the difficultly... you won't be able to do Nightmare unless you have a good mix of lvl 60s in pretty good gear... but the gear is grindable and when you do get good enough gear you can you quickly gear up (a great deal easier, quicker and it's possilble to do solo without needing help). You won't see many players around but the ones you do meet are friendly and will try and help others... balancing has shifted it slightly from what you may expect if you played the original but it's still fun.

If you love character customization and by that i mean choose everything from whether you want to fight or let your towers kick♥♥♥♥♥to making your fat cat with a propeller bright pink just cause it makes you look like a badass.Dungeon Defenders combines Tower Defense and 3rd person combat in a sexy way! I could tell you everything epic about DD but it's better you find out for yourself. They have regular updates that are persuaded by you, yes you choose what you want to happen on DDE and they make it happen. People wanted private taverns and the developers made it, people wanted Nightmare mode released but more of a challenge and the developers made it. People now want DDE to create their Hardcore mode WITHOUT perma-death and the developers have listened and are in the process of making that happen.Enough said, now buy it!That was back in October 2014 and it is now January 31st 2015I am changing my review on DDE because they have just released a new 'balanced' version of the game and well... it has destroyed the entire game completely.All characters stats that were considered good (3,000+) now are beyond disgracegful. All players have lost about 90% or their DPS on towers, the monks auras have been halfed and to make thinks even worse Series EV has had a tower change so there is no longer a tower buff beam.I am not playing DDE for another month and will see if they have rectified this barbaric change to what was an actual decent game and I do NOT recommend you buy this or even play it if you have it.R.I.P DDE Was Decent from version 3.2 up and till version 5.4

content:
Posted: April 25
												This game isn't actually that bad in all honesty. I played the hell out of the first game, so i do notice all the major differences when playing this one and I'm here to say its not that bad.I understand that many people have found this game to be trash/garbage/a waste of money, but its actually still just as fun as the first one. I do disagree with some features that have been changed such as the level cap reduction and some changes with defense towers. but other changes actually made improvments in my opinion. I played the first game on my xbox 360, but I wanted it on my computer so I could play with some friends who also PC gamed. At first I was skeptical and why wouldnt i be considering the 50% positivity rating. But I am actually happy with my purchase, I'm having a lot of fun playing it with my friends and I'm actully not getting any lag or internet connectivity issues.Reasons to buy this over DD1:-better UI-visual cosmetic items -Includes nearly all DLC (All heros and DLC maps plus some other goodies) -servers arent complete crap like they apparently used to be-This could actually be a great thing if the community actually showed some support for it -some tower differences that you may or may not likeReasons to buy DD1: -higher level cap - more active communitysome tower differences that you may or may not likeOverall its a fine game. I believe that the reason it failed so miserably is due to community backlash during the games initial release causing the devs to lose faith in the project. Hopefully though if it starts attracting some more people, the game may pick up some tempo and finally be finished. I really do hope the devs put a little more time into this. Just something to give the community a little spark because this is honestly worth the money and under appreciated for its value.
